tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

character.name: Ootomo

character.name: Mori Kazushi
character.description: Haru`s psychotherapist. He works in the hospital that Haru was brought back to life in after the fateful accident.

episode.title: see red
See Red
See Red
episode.summary: Ren is forced into the car of a strange man. Natsuki, who bears a striking resemblance to Haru, claims to be the cousin of the Kaidou brothers. Shiba Natsuo tells Ren to keep it a secret from his brothers that they met, but Ren is met by Haru and the twins who were concerned that he was so late coming home. Haru tells Ren to quit his job out of concern, but sick of being treated like a child, Ren says, "I`m not a child"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: white lie
White Lie
White Lie
episode.summary: It`s Ren`s first summer vacation in Japan. The landlord of the apartment he and Haru once lived in hires him to clean one of his apartment units. Haru becomes unbearably curious when Ren refuses to tell him why he got a part time job. Kiyoka suspects Kiri, Ren`s female classmate who has been coming over with her dog to hang out, but...? And while this is happening, an unknown man suddenly approaches Ren--?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: gold star
Gold Star
Gold Star
episode.summary: Because their mother Haruko is staying with them, Haru continues to watch his public displays of affection with Ren. Without much consideration for his situation, Ikuyoshi asks Haru a question. Meanwhile, unable to express his feelings for Haru, Ren and his classmate Juuzen question their school`s doctor Takamura. One day, after hearing about Haru`s medical checkup after the accident, Aki aggressively attacks Haruko... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: in the pink
In the Pink
In the Pink
episode.summary: It`s been three months since Haru`s dream to live under the same roof with all three of his brothers came true. However, the situation at the Kaidou household suddenly becomes stormy when Haruko announces she`s taking Ren back to Switzerland with her. Even after Ren hears about Haruko`s secret loneliness from Miki, he still wishes to stay in Japan as long as Haru wants him. But unable to express his desire in words, Ren continues to remain "just a brother" to Haru... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: heavy fog
Heavy Fog
Heavy Fog
episode.summary: Unable to stand being treated by a child by Haru, Ren leaves the house. Natsuo agrees to let Ren stay over when he suddenly shows up at his apartment, but Haru shows up just as he`s about to grant Ren`s request to do something that he "can`t tell Haru about." Haru tells Ren to not come home ever again, but...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: sweet peach
Sweet Peach
Sweet Peach
episode.summary: A new tenant is moving into Onodera`s aparment where Haru and Ren used to live, and Ren is helping to clean the room. The man who appears with Onodera is Takamura, the school nurse at Ren`s high school. Meanwhile, a female customer begins showing up at cafe WHITE FANG practically every day to talk to Haru. Aki and Shima realize she`s the girl from the marriage meeting photo, but...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: marine blue
Marine Blue
Marine Blue
episode.summary: The accident that made Haru lose his parents seven years ago left him on the brink of death. Though he made a miraculous recovery, he hasn`t gone to the hospital for a checkup since he was released, so a concerned Aki and Shima ask Ren to take him there. Unaware of the situation, Haru believes Ren is taking him on a date, but they end up at the hospital... Meanwhile, while waiting for Haru in the waiting area, Haru`s psychotherapist Mori strikes up a conversation with Ren... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: black and white
Black and White
Black and White
episode.summary: Ren spends the night away from home and brings home a large amount of money. Haru, who was up all night with worry, begins acting cold towards Ren when he won`t tell him why. The next morning, Ren heads out to his friend Kiri`s house to train her family`s dog without clearing the air between them. In order to avoid being at cross-purposes with each other, Haru goes to buy a new phone for Ren. However, a strange man calls Ren`s cell phone, and...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: happy days
Happy Days
Happy Days
episode.summary: Since Haru declared that he belongs to Ren, Ren has stopped making unreasonable requests. Though plenty of women still come to the cafe, Haru has begun flatly rejecting them, and their days are peaceful. Meanwhile, Natsuo is experiencing emotions he can`t express in words. His irration with the former number one host "Natsu," and his childhood memories of Haru. As this is happening, he hears the Kaidou family has decided to hold a birthday party for Aki and Shima, and...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: silver lining
Silver Lining
Silver Lining
episode.summary: Since Haru told Ren to stay away from Natsuo, though on the surface their life appears normal, the relationship between Haru and Ren has become awkward. Ren`s strangely obedient and quiet behavior reminds Haru of the time two years ago when he returned to Canada alone and makes him uneasy. Meanwhile, Ren says he`ll give up on Haru if he doesn`t want to do it with him... Source: crunchyroll
